Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a thick-walled pink-orange pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of nine lines of closely written Coptic text written in black ink, now faded.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393259) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393259)
